intro: Aiphanes kalbreyeri, commonly known as the coastal grass or Kalbreyer's grass, is a species of flowering plant in the family Poaceae. It is native to the coastal regions of South America, particularly in countries like Argentina and Chile. This plant is characterized by its tall, slender stems and narrow, grass-like leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is well adapted to saline and coastal environments. Aiphanes kalbreyeri plays an important ecological role in stabilizing dunes and preventing erosion along coastal areas.
